data.title: Virtual Puzzle Games for Team
data.meta_description: Murder Mysteries | Immersive Dinners | Private Parties | Virtual Games | Corporate Events | NYC
data.text:
Beverly Lillz was murdered weeks ago, but her friends and family think they may be getting messages from her from beyond the grave.

Groups will work together to sort through the clues and find Beverly's killer. Can you unravel the clues she's left behind?

​

Inspired by our highly acclaimed immersive production Where the F is Beverly? and adapted for a virtual setting.

Deck the halls with comedy and clues. It’s a Mediocre Life is the story of an elf who lost their bells. Can you help them complete a series of puzzles in order to get them back?

Navigate this make-believe world, meeting zany characters and perusing holiday clues in search of the magic that will restore them.

A well-known symbol of luck has gone missing, and the detective assigned to the case is in need of your help to solve this mystery.

​

Together your team will solve puzzles, break codes, and visit obscure corners of the Internet, on a mission to recover what was taken.

This experience is a comedic hunt that takes you through a variety of instagram profiles in search of missing treasure.

​

Tracing Spheres is a virtual game that can be played any time, anywhere, and with anyone. the cost is $40 to play. Play with as many (or as few) friends as you'd like.

Perfect for remote teams who want to stay connected. This experience consists of trivia, mini team quests and unique riffs on popular games.

Your group will be broken up into teams. Groups will be competing against one another in an epic battle to determine how fit is your wit?
